thread.title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Property Taxes, Renters, VW Bugs

author: WSJ Staff
title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Property Taxes, Renters, VW Bugs
text: Investments that track broad stock indexes have become the favorite of many investors and analysts for long-term returns that are hard to beat–but index tracking hasn’t done so well in the commodities market, writes Simon Constable. Stock investments that track indexes such as the S&P 500 have reliably rewarded long-term investors. But commodity indexes haven’t   Russian Ruble Tumbles Further on Political Shocks Next China Soothes Trade War-Weary Investors—Energy Journal
